definitions: person who regularly wagers money on games of chance or uncertain outcomes
examples: The professional gambler calculated odds before placing any bets
Her uncle was a compulsive gambler who lost his savings

definitions: practice of risking money or valuables on games or events with uncertain outcomes
examples: Online gambling has become increasingly popular worldwide
The state banned gambling except in designated casinos

definitions: structured form of play with rules and objectives for entertainment
wild animals hunted for sport or food
calculated strategy or scheme to achieve a goal
examples: The children invented a new game using bottle caps
Board games bring families together on rainy afternoons
The hunters tracked big game through the African savanna
Game reserves protect endangered species from poachers
His political game involved forming strategic alliances
She saw through his game of pretending ignorance

definitions: person employed to manage and protect game animals on an estate
examples: The gamekeeper patrolled the estate checking for poachers
She worked as a gamekeeper on a Scottish highland estate

definitions: traditional Indonesian ensemble music featuring bronze percussion instruments including gongs and metallophones
examples: The gamelan orchestra performed at the cultural festival
Learning gamelan requires understanding complex rhythmic patterns

definitions: mature sexual reproductive cell containing half the genetic material that unites with another during fertilization
examples: Sperm and egg cells are examples of human gametes
The biology class studied gamete formation in plants

definitions: activity of playing electronic or video games competitively or recreationally
practice of playing games of chance for money or stakes
examples: Professional gaming tournaments offer million-dollar prizes
His gaming setup included multiple monitors and custom equipment
Gaming regulations vary significantly between different states
The casino expanded its gaming floor last year

definitions: third letter of the Greek alphabet used in mathematics and science
high-energy electromagnetic radiation emitted by radioactive substances
measure of contrast in photographic or display systems
examples: The equation used gamma to represent the unknown variable
Gamma appears frequently in physics and engineering formulas
Gamma rays can penetrate most materials except dense lead
Medical imaging sometimes uses controlled gamma radiation
Adjusting the monitor's gamma improves image quality
The photographer corrected the gamma levels in post-processing

definitions: bottom portion of bacon side including the hind leg cured like ham
victory in backgammon where opponent has not removed any pieces
examples: She served honey-glazed gammon with pineapple rings
The butcher recommended gammon steaks for the barbecue
He achieved a gammon by bearing off all pieces first
Scoring a gammon doubles the stakes in tournament play

definitions: entire range or scope of something from one extreme to another
examples: Her emotions ran the gamut from joy to despair
The store offers the full gamut of camping equipment

definitions: adult male goose distinguished from the female by larger size
informal brief look or glance at something
examples: The gander protected his mate while she nested
A large gander chased visitors away from the pond
Take a gander at these sales figures
Let me have a quick gander at the menu

definitions: organized group of criminals who control territory or illegal activities
group of workers or laborers organized for a specific task
informal group of friends who regularly spend time together
examples: Police arrested members of the street gang
Gang violence has decreased in the neighborhood
The construction gang finished paving the road
A gang of electricians rewired the building
Her gang meets every Friday for dinner
The whole gang showed up for his birthday

definitions: world or environment of organized crime and gang activities
examples: The gangland killing shocked the quiet neighborhood
Journalists investigated gangland connections to local businesses

definitions: structure containing nerve cell bodies located outside the central nervous system
benign fluid-filled swelling that develops near joints or tendons
examples: The dorsal root ganglion processes sensory information
Damage to the ganglion affected nerve signal transmission
The ganglion cyst on her wrist required surgical removal
A ganglion often appears as a visible bump under skin

definitions: death and decay of body tissue caused by infection or lack of blood supply
examples: Untreated frostbite can lead to gangrene requiring amputation
The surgeon removed tissue affected by gangrene

definitions: style of hip-hop music featuring lyrics about urban gang life
member of a street gang particularly in hip-hop culture
examples: Gangsta rap emerged from West Coast hip-hop scenes
The album featured classic gangsta beats and lyrics
He portrayed himself as a gangsta in his music videos
The film depicted the life of a reformed gangsta

definitions: member of an organized group of violent criminals especially from prohibition era
examples: The museum exhibit featured artifacts from famous gangsters
Al Capone was a notorious Chicago gangster

definitions: movable bridge or ramp for boarding or leaving a ship
narrow passage between rows of seats or through a crowd
examples: Passengers boarded the cruise ship via the gangway
The crew secured the gangway before departure
The usher directed people down the gangway to their seats
Clear the gangway for emergency evacuation

definitions: marijuana or cannabis especially as used in Rastafarian and Caribbean culture
examples: The police discovered a large ganja plantation
Ganja use is central to some religious practices

definitions: large white seabird with black-tipped wings that plunge-dives for fish
examples: Gannets nest in huge colonies on coastal cliffs
The gannet dove from great height to catch fish

definitions: bridge-like framework structure supporting equipment such as cranes or signals
examples: The rocket stood ready on the launch gantry
Workers operated the gantry crane to load containers

definitions: British spelling of jail meaning place of confinement for criminals
examples: The historic gaol now serves as a museum
Prisoners escaped from the local gaol last night

definitions: space or opening between two things or parts
noticeable difference or disparity between two things or groups
break or pause in continuity or sequence of events
examples: She squeezed through a gap in the fence
The dentist fixed the gap between his front teeth
The wage gap between executives and workers continues growing
There's a significant gap in their skill levels
After a gap of ten years, they finally reunited
The gap in her employment history raised questions

definitions: wide opening of the mouth or other opening
act of staring with mouth open in surprise
examples: The gape of the cave entrance was twenty feet wide
The baby bird's gape triggered the parent's feeding response
His gape of astonishment lasted several seconds
The crowd's collective gape showed their amazement

definitions: long-bodied freshwater fish with elongated jaws filled with sharp teeth
examples: The gar lurked near the surface waiting for prey
Alligator gar can grow over eight feet long

definitions: building or part of building for housing motor vehicles
commercial establishment for repairing and servicing vehicles
raw energetic rock music style originating in the 1960s
examples: She parked her car in the two-car garage
The garage door opener stopped working yesterday
The garage fixed her transmission in one day
Take your car to the garage for an oil change
The band played garage rock at local venues
Garage punk influenced many later music styles

definitions: distinctive clothing or dress especially relating to occupation or culture
examples: The judge wore traditional judicial garb in court
Monks dressed in simple religious garb

definitions: discarded waste material especially from households requiring disposal
worthless or meaningless material, ideas, or information
examples: The garbage truck collects trash every Tuesday morning
Please separate recyclables from regular garbage
That article is complete garbage with no facts
Don't believe that garbage about miracle cures

definitions: piece of ground for growing flowers, vegetables, or herbs
public park or area with plants for recreation and display
examples: She grows tomatoes in her vegetable garden
The garden bloomed with colorful spring flowers
The botanical garden features rare tropical plants
Families picnicked in the public garden

definitions: person who tends and cultivates gardens professionally or as a hobby
examples: The gardener pruned the roses every spring
She hired a gardener to maintain the estate grounds

definitions: evergreen shrub with glossy leaves and fragrant white or yellow flowers
examples: The gardenia's sweet fragrance filled the entire room
She wore a white gardenia in her hair

definitions: activity or hobby of tending and cultivating gardens and plants
examples: Weekend gardening helps her relax after stressful workdays
Gardening requires knowledge of soil and climate conditions

definitions: carved stone grotesque figure projecting from building to channel rainwater
decorative carved figure of a grotesque creature on buildings
examples: Medieval gargoyles directed rainwater away from cathedral walls
The gargoyle's open mouth served as a water spout
Gothic gargoyles were believed to ward off evil spirits
Stone gargoyles decorated the university's architecture

definitions: decorative wreath or rope of flowers, leaves, or other material
examples: Wedding guests wore garlands of tropical flowers
Christmas garlands decorated the stairway banister

definitions: strong-smelling bulb used as flavoring in cooking and medicine
examples: She minced fresh garlic for the pasta sauce
Garlic has natural antibacterial properties

definitions: single item of clothing worn on the body
examples: The dry cleaner carefully pressed each garment
Traditional garments reflected the region's cultural heritage

definitions: deep red semi-precious stone used in jewelry and as an abrasive
examples: Her grandmother's garnet ring became a family heirloom
January's birthstone is the deep red garnet

definitions: decorative or flavorful accompaniment added to food or drinks
legal seizure of wages or property to satisfy a debt
examples: The chef added a parsley garnish to the plate
Fresh herbs make excellent garnishes for cocktails
The court ordered a garnish of his wages
Creditors can garnish bank accounts for unpaid debts

definitions: small room or apartment just below the roof of a house
examples: The artist lived in a cramped garret overlooking the city
She converted the garret into a cozy reading nook

definitions: fortified military post where troops are stationed
body of troops stationed at a particular location
examples: The garrison protected the frontier from invasion
Supplies were delivered to the remote garrison monthly
The garrison consisted of five hundred soldiers
A small garrison defended the strategic outpost

definitions: elastic band worn around the leg to hold up stockings or socks
examples: The bride wore a blue garter as something borrowed
Victorian women used decorative garters with their stockings

definitions: long deep cut or wound in skin or surface
examples: The accident left a gash across his forehead
A gash in the tree trunk showed lightning damage

definitions: process of converting organic materials into gas through high-temperature treatment with controlled oxygen
examples: Coal gasification produces synthetic natural gas
The plant uses biomass gasification for energy generation

definitions: shaped piece of rubber or other material creating a seal between mechanical parts
examples: The mechanic replaced the blown head gasket
A faulty gasket caused the oil leak

definitions: light produced by burning gas especially in street lamps
psychological manipulation making someone question their own reality
examples: Victorian streets were illuminated by gaslight
The old theater still had original gaslight fixtures
Her ex-partner would gaslight her about past events
The film depicted a classic case of gaslight manipulation

definitions: volatile flammable liquid derived from petroleum used as fuel for engines
examples: Gas prices rose sharply during the summer months
The car requires premium gasoline for optimal performance

definitions: sudden sharp intake of breath from surprise, shock, or difficulty breathing
examples: She let out a gasp when she saw the surprise
His last gasp came just before midnight

definitions: act of killing or harming with poisonous gas
examples: The gassing of troops violated international warfare conventions
Carbon monoxide gassing remains a serious household danger

definitions: medical specialty dealing with disorders of the stomach, intestines, and digestive system
examples: She specialized in gastroenterology after medical school
The gastroenterology department handles colonoscopy procedures

definitions: art and science of good eating including cooking, presentation, and food culture
examples: French gastronomy influences cuisines worldwide
The restaurant is renowned for molecular gastronomy techniques
